p: The FRAP assay was conducted according to Benzie and Strain’s [ 24] method, which consists of finding the compounds’ antioxidant potential in terms of μM ascorbic acid equivalents per gram dry weight (μM AAE/g). l-Ascorbic acid was used as a standard in the FRAP assay with concentrations varying between 0 and 1000 μM. The antioxidant potential of the tested samples was read at a wavelength of 593 nm in a Multiskan (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA) spectrum plate reader.
